description.overall: This function constructs a directed graph representing file dependencies within a repository. It takes a filename, an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST), and the repository root as inputs. The function utilizes a tree visitor to traverse the AST, identifying import dependencies and adding them to the graph. The graph is then returned, encapsulating the dependency relationships between files.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The name of the file for which the dependency graph is being constructed.

parameters.name: tree
parameters.description: The Abstract Syntax Tree representing the file's structure.

parameters.name: repo_root
parameters.description: The root directory of the repository.

returns.name: graph
returns.description: A directed graph representing the file dependencies.

description.overall: This function constructs a directed graph representing the dependencies between files in a Git repository. It iterates over all Python files in the repository, builds a dependency graph for each file using the `build_file_dependency_graph` function, and then aggregates these graphs into a single, global graph. The function returns this global graph as a networkx DiGraph object.

description.overall: The main_workflow function is the primary entry point for the backend processing pipeline. It takes in user input, API keys, and model names, and orchestrates the analysis of a Git repository. The function performs various tasks such as cloning the repository, extracting basic project information, constructing a file tree, analyzing relationships between code elements, and generating an abstract syntax tree (AST). It then uses HelperLLM and MainLLM to analyze functions and classes, and generates a final report.

description.overall: This function updates the feedback for a specific exchange in the database. It takes an exchange ID and a new feedback value as input, and returns the number of documents modified by the update operation. The function uses the PyMongo library to interact with the MongoDB database. It updates a single document in the 'dbexchanges' collection that matches the provided exchange ID. The function returns the number of documents modified, which will be 1 if the update is successful or 0 if the document does not exist.

description.overall: The ASTVisitor class is designed to traverse an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) of Python source code and extract relevant information about its structure. It initializes with source code, file path, and project root, and provides methods to visit different types of nodes in the AST, such as imports, class definitions, and function definitions. The class accumulates information about imports, classes, and functions in a schema.

init_method.description: The constructor of the ASTVisitor class initializes the object with source code, file path, and project root. It sets up the module path and an empty schema to store information about imports, functions, and classes.

parameters.name: source_code
parameters.description: The source code of the Python file being analyzed.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The path to the Python file being analyzed.

parameters.name: project_root
parameters.description: The root directory of the project.

description.overall: This method visits Import nodes in the AST. It extracts the names of imported modules and adds them to the schema's imports list.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The Import node being visited.

description.overall: This method visits ImportFrom nodes in the AST. It extracts the module name and the names of imported modules or variables and adds them to the schema's imports list.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The ImportFrom node being visited.

description.overall: This method visits ClassDef nodes in the AST. It extracts information about the class, such as its name, docstring, and source code, and adds it to the schema's classes list.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The ClassDef node being visited.

description.overall: This method visits FunctionDef nodes in the AST. It extracts information about the function, such as its name, arguments, docstring, and source code, and adds it to the schema's functions list or the current class's methods list.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The FunctionDef node being visited.

description.overall: This method visits AsyncFunctionDef nodes in the AST. It delegates the analysis to the visit_FunctionDef method.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The AsyncFunctionDef node being visited.

usage_context.dependencies: The class depends on the path_to_module function from the backend.AST_Schema module.
usage_context.instantiated_by: The class is not instantiated by any known part of the system.

description.overall: This method analyzes a repository by parsing its Python files and extracting relevant information. It uses the ASTVisitor class to visit each file's AST and gather schema nodes.

description.overall: The FileDependencyGraph class is designed to analyze and resolve file dependencies within a repository. It utilizes the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) to parse import statements and determine the actual module or symbol names being imported. The class provides methods to resolve relative imports, visit import statements, and track dependencies between files.

description.overall: The RepoFile class represents an individual file within a Git repository. It provides lazy loading of the file content, allowing for efficient handling of large files. The class offers various methods for accessing file properties, such as its path, size, and content.

init_method.description: The constructor initializes a RepoFile object with a given file path and commit tree. It sets up the object's state by storing the file path and commit tree, and initializes internal variables for lazy loading of the file's blob, content, and size.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The path to the file within the repository.

parameters.name: commit_tree
parameters.description: The Tree object of the commit from which the file originates.

description.overall: This property lazy-loads the Git blob object associated with the file. If the blob is not already loaded, it attempts to retrieve it from the commit tree. If the file is not found, it raises a FileNotFoundError.

returns.name: blob
returns.description: The Git blob object representing the file.

description.overall: This property lazy-loads and returns the decoded content of the file. If the content is not already loaded, it reads the content from the blob's data stream and decodes it using UTF-8.

returns.name: content
returns.description: The decoded content of the file.

description.overall: This property lazy-loads and returns the size of the file in bytes. If the size is not already loaded, it retrieves it from the blob's size attribute.

returns.name: size
returns.description: The size of the file in bytes.

description.overall: This method analyzes the file content and returns the word count. It splits the content into words using whitespace as a delimiter and returns the number of words.

returns.name: word_count
returns.description: The number of words in the file content.

description.overall: This method converts the RepoFile object to a dictionary representation. It includes the file's path, name, size, and type. If include_content is True, it also includes the file content.

parameters.name: include_content
parameters.description: Whether to include the file content in the dictionary.

returns.name: data
returns.description: The dictionary representation of the RepoFile object.

description.overall: The ProjectAnalyzer class is designed to analyze a project by traversing its directory structure, identifying Python files, and resolving function and method calls within those files. description.overall: The CallResolverVisitor class is designed to traverse an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) of Python code and resolve function calls, tracking the call relationships and context.

description.overall: The ClassContext class is a Pydantic model that describes the external dependencies and primary points of instantiation for a given class. It has two main attributes: dependencies and instantiated_by, both of which are strings. This class seems to be part of a larger system for documenting or analyzing class structures, providing a simple way to track where a class is used and what it depends on.

parameters.description: A string describing where the class is instantiated.
